EmailTemplate.subject: TA13-004 - Critical information regarding Microsoft hotfix rollup and ArcGIS
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
STAY CONNECTED <http://www.facebook.com/pages/Tritech-Software-Systems/89416081839> <http://twitter.com/tritechsoftware> <http://www.linkedin.com/companies/tritech-software-systems> <http://www.youtube.com/user/TriTechSoftware> Technical Advisory TA13-004 - Critical information regarding Microsoft hotfix rollup and ArcGIS POSTED: 04-29-13
Dear Clients,
If you have applied Microsoft hotfix roll-up KB 2775511 <http://autobahn.esri.com/esri/etrack.aspx?DSN=b9ca57b2fbe8cb42458807853387983f6a0f6be5ccdab113&FORMID=40d1deb2ef07213490f70d8f652ed1a8&AUDID=217889fb4e6179c5014872e28113df3b&EMAILID=915ca8eb2542e31d4cb846c44c1e416e49c0fb426f3b73b1&DECODE=1&INTID=57fa4c9b3b897ae137b24f8b95cfa6ae&URL=http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2775511> and created file geodatabases on a shared network location from a Windows 7 SP1 or a Windows 2008 R2 SP1 machine, your file geodatabases are unusable. You will see an error message referencing the item type when you create new datasets or items in a file geodatabase.
For example, the following message will appear when creating a new feature class:
"Failed to create feature class. The item was not found. [ItemType: {70737809-852C-4A03-9E22-2CECEA5B9BFA}]"
Cause This issue is still under investigation.
Workaround Esri is working on a patch to mitigate this issue. There are currently several workarounds.
See Esri Knowledge Base article 41119 <http://autobahn.esri.com/esri/etrack.aspx?DSN=b9ca57b2fbe8cb42458807853387983f6a0f6be5ccdab113&FORMID=40d1deb2ef07213490f70d8f652ed1a8&AUDID=217889fb4e6179c5014872e28113df3b&EMAILID=915ca8eb2542e31d4cb846c44c1e416e49c0fb426f3b73b1&DECODE=1&INTID=57fa4c9b3b897ae137b24f8b95cfa6ae&URL=http://support.esri.com/en/knowledgebase/techarticles/detail/41119/?WT.mc_id=EmailCampaign15945> for further information and updates.
